You must select a choice before completing an event
You must select a reward before closing the results screen
Selecting 'Yes' will teleport you and your party members to Stormfall in %1s.
Teleportation to the activity will commence in %1s
Right-Click this item to apply it to an Expedition.
You cannot apply this item to an Expedition.
Insert a Map or Reverie here to access its content.

<font color="#E5D8B6">Stormfall Palace has long been the home of Stormfallâs leaders. It is where the cityâs council meet in order to table their concerns regarding Stormfallâs current state of affairs and to debate the merits of new initiatives before they are authorised by the head of state.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">The Seekers have been around since Stormfallâs inception. As an organisation, they are devoted to exploring Wolcenâs wilderness and uncovering its hidden treasures. The garrison ensures that Seekers are at the peak of their physical conditioning, and trains them in the traversal of dangerous terrain.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">The Trade Assembly serves as the main hub for distributing Stormfallâs exports and handling any diplomacy on the city's behalf. The Assemblyâs caravans once traveled to the farthest corners of the continent, and if they could so again, they would help usher in a new age of prosperity for Stormfall.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">The Dark Market is the perfect place for finding the most sought after equipment and materials in Wolcen, things that are not usually sold by the usual stock of merchants. Mohabi has cultivated relationships with the marketâs members and is willing to curate equipment and materials on your behalf.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">Demetra has perfected a technique that allows her to alter the shape and properties of any items or equipment. She has designed a forge tailored specifically to this task. She welcomes you to throw any unused equipment in the forge in the hopes that it may return something more attuned to your skill-set.</font>
<font color="#E5D8B6">The Diamond Bank serves as a replacement to Stormfallâs Central Bank, destroyed during the undead rising. A vault within has been designed for your own personal use.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">After the discovery of Anankis, an ill-fated team was established to explore the Primordial megastructure. They returned a number of weeks later, survivors carrying a shrouded artifact. The nobles decided to bury it, afraid of the power humming from its surface...</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">Demetraâs research into enneracts has led her to understand them on a microscopic level. With the equipment in her new laboratory, Demetra now has the tools at her disposal to duplicate enneracts.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">Demetra has a keen interest in the magical energies of Wolcen. Since meeting you, she has looked into ways of siphoning these energies from their sources. She has now mastered the process with her Siphon Chamber, and she is willing to trade gold for any surplus energy you may have.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">Demetraâs Energy Instillator serves the opposite purpose of her Siphon Chamber. Rather than extract magical energy, this device allows her to transfer energy from her stores into the body of a host. She is not incredibly keen on parting with it, but given your status, she is willing to trade it for gold.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">In the past, the Cartographical Archives have been a symbol of Stormfallâs exploratory spirit. A vast library of maps, explorerâs journals, and tall tales, the Archives were the first port of call for anyone trying to decipher a treasure map or solve a mystery. In its prime, merchants from all over fought over its contents in auctions.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6"> The Stormfall Institute was once home to the best and brightest minds that Stormfall had to offer. With the recent discovery of the primordial technology in Anankis, the work usually conducted by the Institute seems more pressing than ever. The West Wing has always focused on research into ancient power sources. </font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">The Main Exhibition was the Instituteâs pride and joy, attracting scientists and researchers from all over the continent. When it was destroyed, many of the prized artifacts on display were ruined beyond recovery. However, with the discovery of Anankis, the Institute should have no shortage of curiosities to display to the public.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6"> The Stormfall Institute was once home to the best and brightest minds that Stormfall had to offer. With the recent discovery of the primordial technology in Anankis, the work usually conducted by the Institute seems more pressing than ever. The East Wing has always been devoted to finding and researching ancient mechanisms from all over Wolcen. </font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">Before it was buried, the Salt Baths were embedded in a rock face looking out to sea. The water for the baths was drawn from the sea, and many citizens believed that its waters held magical, re-vitalizing energy - they still do. </font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">A vast, ornate temple, the Refuge of the Blind once served as a spiritual link between Stormfall and the Blind Monks of MorkaÑ. A small order of monks used to reside there, providing blessings to the people, blessings said to give the receiver the ability to find more wealth in all of their endeavors.</font>

<font color="#E5D8B6">Stormfallâs Shipyard has been the birthplace of some of the greatest ships to ever have graced the open seas. Before it ran into a state of disrepair, foreign dignitaries would visit and watch the shipwrights, marveling at the focus and precision of their work.</font>

Renovations on the Cartographical Archives are ready to begin. What is left of the documents in the Archiveâs wreckage will need to be recovered and handled delicately if they are to be restored to their places in the Archives. Should the restoration efforts be successful, Stormfallâs merchants are sure to clamor for some arrangement that allows them some level of access to its resources. Outcomes:

Buying prices at merchants will be permanently decreased. Selling prices at merchants will be permanently increased.

Renovation efforts were a success, and the Cartographical Archives have been restored to their former glory. Hearing news of its renovations, merchants from across the continent have been begging for access, even lowering the prices of their goods in the hopes that Stormfall will grant them access.
The Archives have been restored, decreasing buying prices and increasing selling prices at merchants.

Renovations are ready to be carried out on the West Wing of the Institute. Aside from the rebuilding efforts, a number of Stormfallâs scientists are eager to begin studying anything found in the depths of Anankis. To this end, they implore you to send another expedition into Anankis to provide them with new ancient power sources to study. After all, what use are a bunch of scientists with nothing to look at? Outcomes:

A 5th Skill Slot will be unlocked.

Renovations have been completed on the West Wing of the Stormfall Institute. The expedition into Anankis was able to find plenty of Primordial power sources for the scientists to pour their minds over. There was something else as well, a metal tablet, symbols inscribed over its surface. No one knew what they meant, or had the means of deciphering them... But you, did you remember seeing such a thing before? When you looked at it for yourself, you felt the tablet's meaning reach out to you.
The right piece of the Tablet makes your Primordial connection stronger (5th Skill Slot unlocked)

Renovations are ready to be carried out on the Instituteâs main building, the old home for its largest exhibition. For your scientists, it is really important that the main building be a testament to the Institute's prestige as a research institution. To that end, they recommend a prolonged expedition into Anankis, with the goal of uncovering the most beautiful and mesmerising examples of Primordial technology for the Insitute's Exhibition Hall. Outcomes:

Your Primordial Essence meter will be permanently increased.

Renovations on the Instituteâs Main Exhibition have been completed. The expedition into Anankis was able to find plenty of Primordial power sources for the scientists to pour their minds over. There was something else as well, a metal tablet, symbols inscribed over its surface. No one knew what they meant, or had the means of deciphering them... But you, did you remember seeing such a thing before? It was a marvel to behold, and when your eyes dwelt on its symbols, a wave of energy swelled in your mind and body, and you had the sense that your Ascended ancestors were by your side, imbuing you with their strength.
The completed Tablet strengthens your Ascended powers. (Permanent increase to Primordial Essence)

Renovations are ready to be carried out on the West Wing of the Institute. Aside from the rebuilding efforts, a number of Stormfallâs scientists are eager to begin studying anything found in the depths of Anankis. To this end, they implore you to send another expedition into Anankis to provide them with new ancient machinery to study. Without this influx of new artifacts to study, the scientists fear that the new Institute will lose all credibility. Outcomes:

You will receive +1 Passive Skill Point.

Renovation work on the East Wing of the Stormfall Institute has been completed. The expedition into Anankis was able to find plenty of Primordial power sources for the scientists to pour their minds over. There was something else as well, a metal tablet, symbols inscribed over its surface. No one knew what they meant, or had the means of deciphering them... But you, did you remember seeing such a thing before? When your eyes first looked over the new tablet, you felt the words carved on its surface reverberate through your being, filling you with a newfound sense of strength.
The left piece of the Tablet has given you renewed strength (+1 Passive Skill Slot)

Excavation work is ready to begin on the Salt Baths. Debris will need to be removed from the various cave-ins that have buried the interior. Once complete, the baths themselves will be renovated, allowing the waters of Stromfallâs coast to re-vitalize you and your citizens once more .Renovate The Salt Baths of Stormfall. Outcomes:

You will receive a permanent Magic-Find boost.

Water from the sea flows once more into the Salt Baths of Stormfall, enticing thousands of citizens to visit on any given day. You went yourself, and after bathing in its waters for a few hours, you left feeling inspired, more sensitive to the magic of the world.
The Salt Baths have been renovated, giving you a permanent Magic-Find boost.

Preparations have been made for the renovation of the Refuge for the Blind. Once it has been rebuilt, the link between Stormfall and the Blind Monks of MorkaÑ will be restored, giving the public, and you, access to their blessings. Renovate the Refuge for the Blind. Outcomes:

You will receive a permanent Gold-Find boost.

The Refuge For The Blind has been successfully renovated. Representatives from the Blind Monks of MorkaÑ have been welcomed back to the city of Stormfall, strengthening the bond between the order and the people who benefit the most from their sacrifice. Thankful for the restoration of their refuge, the monks bestow you with a powerful blessing. When you left the Refuge, gold seemed to just fall into your lap. As you walked the streets, gold would appear on the floor as if from thin airâ¦
The Refuge has been renovated, giving you a permanent Gold-Find boost.

Having discussed the Seekers with Eugene and the council, plans have been drawn up to facilitate the renovation of the old garrison. Outcomes:

Seekers Expeditions will become available.
As you wished, the Seekers Garrison has now been renovated. Scores of new Seekers have been trained and are now awaiting your instruction, eager to explore the world of Wolcen.
The Seekers Garrison has been renovated, allowing you to send Seekers on expeditions.

Plans have been developed to direct the renovation of the Trade Assembly. At your word, resources will be committed to its completion. Outcomes:

Diplomatic Missions will become available.

The Trade Assembly has now been renovated. Stormfallâs diplomats have been preparing caravans and planning numerous missions to foreign states, many of which are ready and awaiting your authorization.
The Trade Assembly has been renovated, allowing you to send diplomats on trade missions.

After doing some research into the Dark Market, Mohabi has discovered an entity called âThe Curatorâ, someone who mediates the disputes between the various service providers and their customers. They are also said to have access to certain Ethereal Reagents that can alter the ways items interact with the world. Outcomes:

The Project "Procure Ethereal Reagents" will become available. The Project "Establish Contact: 'Dark Smith' will become available.

After much deliberation and clandestine discussion (and the substantial offering of coin made), the Curator agreed to welcome you as a patron of the Dark Market. They will be willing to curate Ethereal Reagents for you; they can also put you in touch with other contacts and their corresponding services should you wish.
You can now procure Ethereal Reagents and establish new contacts through the Curator.

Demetraâs plans for her âTransmutation Forgeâ have been finalised and are now awaiting authorisation. Outcomes:

The Project "Transmute Item" will become available. The Project "Upgrade Forge" will become available.
The Transmutation Forge has finished construction. Now that it is ready, Demetra invites you to throw your unwanted gear into the forge. She is anxious to see the results.
The Transmutation Forge has been constructed, allowing you transmute items and equipment.

Demetra has been experimenting with ways to make the transmutation process more powerful. She believes that if she can find a more efficient way of channeling the energy that catalyzes the transmutation process, there may be a possibility that the transmuted item will be of a higher rarity. Outcomes:

Creates the chance that transmuted items will have a higher rarity.

After some tinkering, Demetra has managed to alter the capabilities of the Transmutation Forge. She says the chance of it happening is not incredibly high, but any items you place in the forge have a chance to emerge as something entirely new, and now in a higher rarity to its predecessor.
The Transmutation Forge upgraded, transmuted items can now be in a higher rarity.

Plans have been drawn up for the Diamond Bank. Once the necessary resources are diverted, construction can begin immediately. Outcomes:

Unlocks an additional Stash tab. The "Upgrade Vault" Projects will become available.
Construction has been completed and the Diamond Bank is now open for business. Should you need to store any of your unused items, your vault is now ready to be used as storage.
The Diamond Bank has been constructed, allowing you to store items and equipment in its vault.

The nobles have buried the 'Ark of Anankis' in a cave, fearful of the terror it had inflicted on the team that had uncovered it. If ordered to do so, they will send a team of Thunderblades to recover the artifact and bring it back to the palace and into your possession. They believe that you, being no stranger to Primordial phenomenons, may be able to unlock its secrets and harness its power, whatever that may be. Outcomes:

An additional Aspect of Apocalypse Token will be unlocked.

The Anankis artifact was recovered successfully. After the thunderblades transferred it into your possession, you took it to your chamber in the palace before removing the shroud. When you removed it, you realized it was a small container, and inside you found a smooth, metal tablet inscribed with symbols that, although youâve never seen before, you seem to understand intuitively. You felt its knowledge swell within you, implanting the image of a new Aspect upon your mind. You coudl sense that there were other artifacts like this. Perhaps they too could strengthen your attunement to the magical forces in the world...
The âArk of Anankisâ has been recovered, giving you access to another Aspect of Apocalypse.

Demetra has created plans for her new laboratory, and a list of all the tools she will need for the enneract duplication process. Should you give the word, she will be able to to begin setting up everything she needs. Outcomes:

Unlocks the Skill Duplication feature at Demetra's stall. The Project "Upgrade Lab: Diamond Tools" will become available.
Construction has finished on the Enneract Lab. Demetra has all the tools she needs for the duplication process and is now awaiting your instruction.
The Enneract Lab has been constructed, allowing you to create two copies of an enneract of your choosing.

Plans have been drawn up for Demetraâs Siphon Chamber. She seems a bit too eager to extract the magical energy inside of you, but the gold you would receive in return should be more than enough to compensate.Whenever you are ready, she will begin making the necessary arrangements for its construction. Outcomes:

The Projects that convert Primordial Affinity into Gold will become available.
Work has been completed on Demetraâs Siphon Chamber. Needless to say, she is eager to try it out at the earliest opportunity.
The Siphon Chamber has been constructed, allowing you to convert Primordial Affinity into Gold.

Demetra has drawn up plans for her Energy Instillator. She seems far less eager to part with her stores of magical energy, but it only seems fair that she give you the opportunity to get the energy you need. She is ready to begin setting it up whenever you are. Outcomes:

The Projects that convert Gold into Primordial Affinity will become available.
Demetra has finished putting together her Injector Seat. Sheâs not in a rush for you to try it out, but itâs ready for you if you need it.
The Injector Seat has been constructed, allowing you to convert Gold into Primordial Affinity.

Stormfallâs Shipyard has been out of action for far too long. Its shipwrights are known throughout the continent for the deftness of their hands in the pursuit of their craft, and the sheer magnificence of the ships they have birthed. Throughout the city, many citizens have eagerly awaited Stormfallâs return to the sea, for their curious and exploratory spirits to be unleashed upon the waves. Perhaps it is time that you indulged them. Outcomes:

Projects that require ships will become available.

Stormfallâs Shipyard is once again open for business, and Stormfallâs old shipwrights, hearing that their hands were needed once again, returned to provide their services. Before long, the Shipyard began birthing new ships, providing Stormfall with the means of returning to the seas in pursuit of its goals.
The Shipyard has been renovated, allowing you to undertake Projects that require ships.

Should you wish, Mohabi believes there is plenty of scope for expanding your personal vault within the Diamond Bank. After all, you can never have enough loot, and it would be a shame if you had to wantonly discard your treasures. Outcomes:

A new stash tab will be unlocked.

Although some architects advising the project were afraid of how digging further beneath the Bank would affect its integrity, the vaultâs expansion went off without any serious drawbacks. With the new space, you should be able to store more of the treasures you have found throughout your adventures.
Your personal vault was upgraded, unlocking a new stash tab.

According to Demetra, each time an Enneract is duplicated, the structure of each duplicate changes, becoming more complex and harder to analyze. Without new, more precise tools with which to carry out the delicate procedure, she will be unable to create more duplicates beyond the one she can already create. Diamond tools should provide the precision she needs to duplicate Enneracts up to a second duplicate. Outcomes:

Demetra will be able to create two duplicates of every skill at her stall.

Forging Diamond tools was an ordeal in itself, requiring an extreme amount of heat to bond it to metal. However, with Demetraâs supervision, new tools have been manufactured; she should now be able to undertake the delicate procedure for duplicating an enneract for the second time.
The Enneract Lab has been upgraded, allowing her to copy Enneracts for a second time.

Mohabi has heard tell of someone in the Dark Market capable of creating higher quality versions of the items they are given. With the appropriate investment behind him, Mohabi should be able this contact, known as âThe Dark Smithâ, and persuade them into providing their services. Have Mohabi establish contact with âThe Dark Smithâ. Outcomes:

The Project "Increase Item Quality" will become available. The Project "Establish Contact: 'GoldenChild'" will become available.
At the behest of the Curator, the Dark Smith was brought into a meeting with Mohabi. After some discussion, the Dark Smith agreed to provide his smithing services to you.
You can now have the Dark Smith create higher quality versions of your items.

Mohabi believes he has found someone in the Dark Market that is able to take any item and curate a rarer version of it. All he knows at the moment is the contactâs alias: GoldenChild. If Mohabi had the necessary resources, he believes he will be able to find this âGoldenChildâ and convince them to offer their services. Have Mohabi establish a contact with the âGoldenChild. Outcomes:

The Project "Increase Item Rarity" will become available. The Project "Establish Contact: 'Dark Smith'" will become available.

The GoldenChild was not easy to find, but with the help of the Curator, Mohabi was able to establish contact. After the appropriate formalities were conducted (they insisted that Mohabi swallow a small nugget of gold as a sign of good faith), the GoldenChild agreed to provide their services.
You can now have the GoldenChild procure your items in a higher rarity.

Mohabi has heard whispers of the one they call the âThe Ethereanâ, someone in the Dark market who straddles the worlds of the living and the dead. Apparently, they can increase the potency of Ethereal Reagents through aritual, the details of which are speculated upon wildly. No ordinary merchant would dare lay their eyes upon these Ethereal Reagents, never mind improve them through some accursed ritual. But, if it is what you desire, and provided you invest the appropriate resources, Mohabi will secure a line of communication with this âThe Ethereanâ. Have Mohabi establish contact with the âThe Ethereanâ. Outcomes:

The Project "Increase Reagent Rarity" will become available.

According to the Curator, the The Etherean is somewhat of an outcast, their practices frightening even to the questionable people that make their living through the Dark Market. However, at Mohabiâs request, the Curator pointed him in the direction of the The Etherean. A meeting ensued, concluding with an agreement between the two parties.
You can now convert Ethereal Reagents to their legendary version through the The Etherean.

Rumor has reached the Dark Market of a special incense newly concocted by an alchemist living in the wilderness around Three-Peaks. The incense is being called "Memory's Echo", and according to the rumors, it transports those that consume it to past experiences, their drugged imaginations conjuring up all sorts of embellishments to their original memory. Bizarrely, those who have survived the experience have kept the objects they became attached to during the memory, leading many to speculate that the incense is more than merely mind-alteringâ¦ If you would like to try it for yourself, perhaps Mohabi could locate this mysterious alchemist from Three Peaks. Outcomes:

You will receive an Uber Boss Expedition Consumable.

After a long and arduous search, Mohabi was able to make contact with this alchemist from Three-Peaks. He has little recollection of the meeting, and was unable to recall the alchemist's features in any detail. Whatever happened during that meeting, it ended with some sort of incense enclosed in Mohabi's palm. He can only assume it is, in fact, "Memory's Echo". There's only one way to find out...
Mohabi has procured a mind-altering drug.

The Dark-Smith possesses the means to increase any itemâs quality through a smithing process known only to them. With an investment of your resources, they will be willing to complete this procedure for one of your items. Outcomes:

Your chosen item will become a higher quality version.

After handing over your item to the Dark Smith, Mohabi was ushered from their working quarters to wait in the street. The sounds Mohabi heard made little sense, not the usual hissing a clanging you might expect from the process of forging a weapon. It almost sounded like there was something alive in there, squealing in ecstasy as the Dark Smith went about their work.
The Dark Smith created a higher quality version of your item

The Golden-Child and their affiliates have access to a vast collection of items and equipment from all over the world of Wolcen. Given the necessary funds, the Golden-Child is willing to take any item of your choosing and procure a higher rarity version of it from his hoard. It will take a while, of course, such a collection can take days to sift through... Outcomes:

Your chosen item will become a higher rarity version.

After handing over your item to the Golden-Child, Mohabi was refused entrance into their collection and was told to return at a later date. After returning, Mohabi was given the item that had been requested, and it was clearly a marked improvement on what you had owned before.
The GoldenChild procured a version of your item in a higher rarity.

If provided with the necessary resources, The Etherean will take any reagent you own and alter it in order to enhance its effects. Not much is known about their process for completing such a procedure, but given the connection of such items to the Eriebe and the Abyss, perhaps it is better not knowingâ¦ Having said that, Mohabi is standing by to go to The Etherean for their services. Outcomes:

Your Reagent will be transformed into its legendary counterpart.
After a long and difficult process (the details of which Mohabi is insistent on not divulging), The Etherean was able to convert your reagent into its legendary counterpart.
The Etherean converted your reagent into its legendary version.

We know little of the islands of BaktoraÃ¯, and our collected intelligence is a hazardous mix of report and old wivesâ tales. Abductions in the dead of night, sorceresses tearing babes from their mothersâ wombs, ivory traders building strange machines from the teeth of men. As a result of their wealth and their sadistic occult practices, many artefacts are left behind there, as are the volatile effects of their magic. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Accesories.

Navigating the BaktoraÃ¯ Archipelago proved a troublesome endeavor for the Seekers. While searching for treasure, a number of skirmishes broke out with occultists roaming the islands. The Seekers were up to the challenge, and managed to overcome occultist forces, eventually stumbling upon an underground structure beneath one of the islands. There they found plenty of artifacts worth looting, and have brought them back to Stormfall.
Your Seekers have returned from the BaktoraÃ¯ Archipelago with Accessories.

The city of Câtul is carried around by two gigantic beasts, as many know. But most are unaware of the many other strange animals that lurk within their territory. Legendary quarries hide themselves in the thickets, their skeletons an inexplicable craggy design, their hides incomparably thick. It will take the strongest arms and the canniest hunters to bring a trophy back. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Rogue Armor.

While in Câtul, the Seekers had to have their wits about them. They walked in the steps of huge creatures, saw twisted silhouettes flit through their vision and the grotesque croaking of monsters echo through the forest. They were lucky enough to come upon a Câtulian hunter, head cleaved cleanly from his body, but armour still intact.
Your Seekers have returned from the Câtulian Hunting Grounds with Rogue Armour(s).

The blood of thousands of soldiers could not quench the Red Wastes. Before Stormfall was Stormfall, before the Republic was the Republic, battles already raged upon these sands. Now, only bones of ancient heroes and their empty plate armours remain where warring souls once stood. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Heavy Armor.

The Red Wastes were hard on the Seeker, draining the moisture from their bodies and dragging their legs into the dry mire of the desert sand. Luckily for them, it was not log before they stumbled upon the site of an old battle. They dislodged the armors that were not rusted beyond recovery from the sand and were able to leave the Wastes unharmed.
Your Seekers have returned from the Red Wastes with Heavy Armor(s).

The fleshy corruption of Cordanon is in decay. Yards upon yards of rotten meat remain, with no survivors left to clear them and no lord willing to claim them. A wealth of abandoned family treasures and fortunes lie beneath the viscera, and the dead have no more use for any of it. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Gold.

Your Seekers spent days sifting through the mountains of melted corpses left at Cordanon. In amongst the flesh, they were able to collect a veritable hoard of gold. The expedition did not sit well with a number of your Seekers; looting the bodies of those who have died in such a grotesque manner, with no burial or any such minor recourse for their suffering. But then, their gold was going to go to waste, and far more unsavory types would loot their corpses if Stormfall did not.
Your Seekers have returned from the Ruins of Cordanon with Gold.

The Halls of Anankis have grown quiet since their power core was extinguished. Some demonic activity remains, but our scholars have been able to scour the grand passages. They contain well-preserved traces of the First Men. More interesting yet, it seemed they lived in service of all-powerful beings able to practice magic far greater than any sorcerersâ of our time. Further study may reveal more about our ancestors. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Mage Armor.

Your Seekers roamed the halls of Anankis, fighting their way through Smugglerâs Path and the Necropolis. The going was tough, and a few casualties were suffered, but they reached Anankis relatively unscathed. It did not take them long before they discovered abandoned armors left behind by the First Men; some of them in tombs, others scattered on the platforms, slain in some ancient conflict.
Your Seekers have returned from Anankis with Mage Armor(s).

YudaÃ¯âs forces still haunt the Necropolis in feeble waves. Efforts to sort out the bones and artefacts within have been arduous, but they reveal that many were entombed during the Necropolisâ completion. The design doesnât match any architecture developed by humans, and yet one canât dismiss it as a similar build to the Halls of Anankis. The construction is clearly thousands of years younger. Who then mightâve overseen its construction? Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Catalysts.

Finding a way into the Necropolis was not an easy problem to solve, but certainly a challenge worthy of the Seekersâ skills. After a number of days searching for a way inside, they stumbled upon a hidden entrance - a crack in one of its walls, formed by the shifting of the earth. Once inside, they found a mausoleum containing the sarcophagi of long-dead Urhans, the old safe-guarders of creation, and inside one of them, a catalyst resonating with a strong magical aura.
Your Seekers have returned from the Necropolis with a Catalyst(s).

When Laibonâs military was still coordinated by the state, a strict hierarchy was in place. Warriors engaged in dishonorable or secret operations werenât granted a traditional funeral. This held true even if they were following orders. When they felt the final decline of sickness or old age, the warriors would carry their heraldric shields out into the desert and seek a final adversary to die fighting, who would grant them honour. The locals may consider it sacrilegious to disturb the dead. One can't blame them. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Shields.

The Seekersâ expedition to the LaÃ¯bonite desert proved a fruitful endeavor. After scrutinizing every dip and rise in the sand, they came across the mangled skeletons of old warriors; those who had died honorably, but ultimately alone, to the monsters in the desert. The warriors were armed only with shields, as though they had not allowed themselves the chance to kill their adversaries and escape with their lives.
Your Seekers have returned from the Laibonite Desert with a Shield(s).

The Republican Purifiers guard their keeps with jealous fervour, and none more than Carrion Keep, which was marked with a distinguishing victory. Grand Inquisitor Heimlock himself reconquered Carrion Keep as a young man, turning it into a symbol more than a fortress. That shining insignia is marred. The Republican Forces come in greater numbers everyday, trying to choke some emergence from within the fortress. If only one could find out what that emergence was. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Staffs.

Infiltrating Carrion Keep was difficult, but your Seekers managed it without alerting the Republic soldiers stationed there to the Seekersâ affiliation with Stormfall. Deep within the labyrinthian keep, in a secret chamber, the Seekers uncovered a small archive, the old lodging of a mage that was once stationed there, and a staff with a powerful aura.
Your Seekers have returned from Carrion Keep with a Staff.

The Radiant Fleet sails proud and haughty in its diamond coats, piercing through the waves of the Sea of Torment. Another fate awaits those with enough hubris to follow their lead but without the coin to ask for the Fleetâs help. They become part of the landscape. The sea washes dregs of old stories, ancient tragedies onto its shores. For those uninterested in tales, the yards of debris have more practical uses. Potential Outcomes:

Temporary Productivity Boost.

Although the coast was treacherous, your Seekers were able to navigate the wreckages. They picked them apart as they went, collecting anything that could be of use to Stormfall. They did not dare stay for too long, for fear of their own ships being dashed against the jagged shore.
Your Seekers have returned from the Coast of Wrecks with materials, boosting Productivity.

It is one thing to travel the endless sea to the eastern continent, another entirely to land on its shores. Few have successfully navigated the turbulent waves on their coasts. Fewer still have set foot on the beaches. Archion harbors the few returning rangers from that continent, and theyâre keen to hold onto those rare charts drawn by the voyagers. One of Stormfallâs finest vessels, the Tempest, was dispatched to the eastern continent, never to return. Weâve sent its successor, the Tempest II, on the same road, hoping to recoup our investment. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Random.

After setting off for unknown shores, the Seekers discovered a small island. There was a settlement there, everything in perfect condition. It seemed as though whoever had lived there had left only moments ago: fires still smoldered, animal corpses turned on their spits; furnaces burned, and molten metal waited to be poured into a mold. No matter how hard they looked, the Seekers could not find the islandâs inhabitants. All they found was a note on a chest in the settlementâs center. It read: âA giftâ.
Your Seekers have returned from an Unknown Shore with Random Loot.

What little intel was gleaned from this facility indicates a weaponsâ research center near the Republicâs borders. The place seems to front as a travellerâs lodge, but large convoys of republican soldiers make frequent trips to and from the facility, often heavier as they leave compared to when they arrived. Whatever they have inside must be valuable military supplies, though likely well protected. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Pistols.

Your Seekers made landfall at the Regicide Research Facility during the early hours of the morning. They were able to sneak in, unseen by the guards stationed on the island. Once inside, they made their way swiftly, disposing of any guards in their path with swift and silent precision. After finding their way to one of the facilityâs laboratories, they discovered a prototype weapon encased in a magical barrier. They brute-forced their way through it, setting off an alarm. Luckily, they were able to make good their escape, and have returned the weapon to Stormfall
Your Seekers have returned from the Regicide Facility with a Legendary Gun.

The Blood Tear Clan are a set of nomadic warriors cast out of Varg into a life of warfare and mercenary work. Their graveyard sites are found off the beaten path. Heads of families often reach a violent end and are buried with all their earthly wealth, their spouse, and personal attendants lying by their side. But not all sleep quietly. Occasionally, servants of the Blood Tear Clan would plant a bundle of hair and teeth on the graves to avenge their entombed fellows. Some speak of three-mouthed beasts who sprout from the soil like trees, and latch their small teeth onto the necks of passersby. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Warrior Armor.

The Seekers arrived at the Burial Site without too much trouble. There were graves, their headstones arranged to be facing each other. Each stone had the same epitaph: âDo not shed a tear over us, for we died crying the blood of our ancestorsâ. Most of the armors on the bodies were punctured, but there was one whose armor was relatively unscathed. It was a fine work of craftsmanship too.
Your Seekers have returned from a Burial Site with Legendary Bruiser Armor(s)

The earth convulsed in Stormfall when Gernese stood against Grand Inquisitor Heimlock, but that shake was only an echo of what was happening up north. Contacts in Varg have spread the word; the crevasse tearing the north apart has grown larger. This is no ordinary scar of the land. The fault distorts light, sound, and emits a steady flow of demons running the people of Varg out of their homes. This threat should be investigated before itâs out of control. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Legendary Ethereal Reagents.

The Seekersâ expedition to the Abyssal Rift was fraught with danger. Getting there was difficult enough, but once there, the energies of the Abyss were enough to overwhelm the strongest of wills. Some Seekers succumbed to its maddening energy, losing all sense of self. Those who remained pushed onward, fortifying themselves against the darkness coiling around their hearts. Their efforts were rewarded: they returned to Stormfall with powerful Ethereal Reagents.
Your Seekers have returned from the Abyssal rift with Legendary Ethereal Reagents.

Ezanealâs faithful donât express devotion by prayer, but by becoming innovators, engineers, experts in the most vanguard technology. His temples are hidden below oceans, in desert sands, behind waterfalls, where none can interfere with what theyâd consider âirresponsibleâ inventions. Those drawn to Ezaneal either seek power, or seek to defend their power. They create firearms to soothe that anxiety a little while, until someone produces a more powerful weapon. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Random Weapons.

The cultists worshipping Ezaneal did not take kindly to the Seekers encroaching on their shrines. A fight ensued, and while the Seekers were not able to best their opponents, they were able to loot a number of the cultistsâ finest weaponry before making their escape.
Your Seekers have returned from a Shrine of Ezaneal with assorted Weapons.

Spikes pierce through mummified skulls. Bridges hang from ropes of dried gut. Prisoners are buried up to their necks and left to die of thirst. The Flayers are a slow and steady predator under the weight of their claymore swords. They may not trade weapons with Stormfall willingly, as they are stateless, and Stormfall is the state. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Two-Handed Melee Weapons.

The Seekersâ incursion into Flayersâ territory was a hard-fought and bloody one. After a number of skirmishes, the Seekers carved out a small section of the territory and looted the best equipment they could find. The only things of worth were the weapons, huge things forged to crush those unfortunate enough to come face to face with a Flayer.
Your Seekers have returned from the Flayersâ Homeland with Two-Handed Melee Weapons.

The expedition proved to be too difficult for the Seekers. Part-way to their destination, they were ambushed by a band of highwaymen, suffering numerous casualties. However, they were able to defeat their leader, and have brought back some of the valuables in their possession.
Your Seekers did not reach their destination, but still managed to bring back some loot.

Part-way through their expedition, your Seekers were forced to make the return to Stormfall. The weather was far worse than they could have anticipated, and numerous Seekers began to suffer and die from exposure. Unwilling to risk the loss of any more lives at the hands of the elements, those remaining made their way back, searching the odd abandoned building to make sure they had something to show.
Your Seekers did not reach their destination, but still managed to bring back some loot.

After arriving at their destination, the Seekers set about exploring. They found a few things here and there, but not in the quantities or qualities that they had been expecting. Despite that, they still consider the expedition to have been a moderate success.
Your Seekers reached their destination, but did not find the loot they had hoped for.

While traveling to their destination, something glinting on the horizon caught the attention of your Seekers. Curiosity, being their most valued trait, drove them to investigate. They came upon an abandoned house and found the source of the glinting to be a plated chest simply left discarded on the porch. Seeing what was inside, they decided that this treasure itself was enough to justify their trip and made their way back to Stormfall.
Your Seekers did not reach their destination, but stumbled upon a treasure hoard instead.

Your Seekers, despite their best efforts, were unable to resist the stormy temperament of the seas. However, after being sent off course, they came across another ship, torn apart by some force of nature. They were able to salvage something from the wreckage, making the trip a not-so-complete failure.
Your Seekers did not reach their destination, but still managed to bring back some loot.

While out on the oceans, your Seekers were intercepted a small band of pirates. However, with some expert maneuvering, they were able to outsmart their assailants and sink their ships. Due to heavy losses, your Seekers considered it prudent to head for home. They were, however, able to retrieve some loot from the sunken ships.
Your Seekers did not reach their destination, but still managed to bring back some loot.

For your Seekers, the sea proved a difficult beast to tame. After being blown off course, they landed on an island. While exploring the island for the means to repair their ship, they stumbled upon an ancient mausoleum. Inside, they found a number of sarcophagi, some of the dead inside buried with their valuables. Not known for passing up such opportunities, they looted the burial site and returned to Stormfall with their findings.
Your Seekers did not reach their destination, but still managed to bring back some loot.

While on their way to their destination, your Seekers seemed to lose their way, sailing into waters they had no knowledge of in their records. Confused - they had taken the usual route to their destination - they were suddenly becalmed in the middle of nowhere. One night, while one of your Seekers was looking out to sea, she noticed something protruding from the still surface. It happened to be a small settlement - flooded only the Primordials know when - and after diving down there, they found more than enough to compensate for their troubles.
Your Seekers did not reach their destination, but still managed to bring back some loot.

It seems that your Seekers must have run into some trouble, for, had they been successful and stuck to their plan, they should have returned to Stormfall long ago. It is very unlikely that they will never return.
Your Seekers did not return from their expedition.

Once your Seekers had arrived at their destination, they scoured it for days, looking for any sign of loot or treasure that may have served to enrich you and the city of Stormfall. Alas, after looking everywhere they could, their efforts turned up absolutely nothing. Tired and dejected, they returned to Stormfall empty-handed.

Your Seekers arrived at their destination, their muscles burning with the effort of their journey. They were energized by the promise of treasure but were forced to return prematurely when assailed by monsters from a nearby nest.

After hitting landfall, you Seekers disembarked and combed over the landscape. Despite following every lead they could, nothing of value ever crossed their paths. Low on supplies and on their last legs, your Seekers decided it best to return to Stormfall, even if it was with nothing to show.

Despite reaching their destination, it seems that the lead your Seekers were pursuing seemed to be somewhat false, or at least the potential treasure they were seeking had been pilfered long before their arrival. Or perhaps they had not looked hard enough. Either way, they have returned with nothing to show.

Stormfall citizens discuss Laibon with a flair of exoticism: theyâll talk overlong about the disappeared god-king who abandoned the kingdom to anarchy and his famed praetorian guard. The truth is that Laibon is a nation like any other, exhausted by the Republican Liberators bringing war to their door. Their civilian militias have done well in protecting trade, but it would be best to make a short journey across the Sea of Torment to avoid crossing the frontier battlelines. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Gold and Primordial Affinity.

Your representatives were welcomed with open arms by the people of Laibon. Although there is no government to conduct trade with, there were plenty of merchants and citizens willing to take what Stormfall had to offer. After a number of transactions with the local populace, the wagons were full of gold and energy crystals ready to be returned to Stormfall.
Your diplomats have returned from Laibon with Gold and Primordial Affinity.

This town is not on any map yet undergoes paradoxical growth. New neighborhoods accumulate in serpentine patterns with little regard for city planning. Despite this, all Tissarinians work and seem well paid by the mysterious owner. It was difficult enough verifying Tissarineâs existence, itâll be harder to find it. That said, the owner pays for their visitorsâ discretion with unique armour pieces out of their own collection, and perhaps far more should we bring the right bouquet... Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Random Armor.

The diplomatic mission to Tissarine was a success. After welcoming your diplomats into her home, the ruler of Tissarine accepted Stormfallâs tribute, and in return, had one of their most prized armor pieces brought from their personal armory.
Your diplomats have returned from Tisserine with Armor Pieces.

The Jewel of Steelâs existence is a challenge to fate itself: it lies nestled in an active volcano. While hazardous, this locale allowed the development of their unique lava forging technique, which creates nigh unbreakable gear when performed correctly. VulkaÃ¯n is an ally to Stormfall as fellow members of the Jeweled Concordat. The road is craggy but the city remains a precious resource in the arms trade. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: One-Handed Melee Weapons.

Your diplomats have returned from Vulkain, the cityâs expertly crafted weapons in tow. As a city of the Jeweled Concordat, Vulkain was more than happy to trade with Stormfall, although your diplomats have returned a little flustered by the entire ordeal. Perhaps it goes without saying, but the smoldering depths of Vulkain are not the most pleasant of places to conduct business.
Your diplomats have returned from Vulkain with One-Handed Melee Weapons.

Far to the north, Greyharbour is an eerie little town shouldered by a forest of twisting trees on one side, and misty waters on the other. They make their trade from logging and fishing. Shipbuilding is a costly activity. To acquire wood at a decent price, it would be best to turn to Greyharbour, though legends surrounding the town frighten the tradesmen. Potential Outcomes:

Temporary Productivity Boost.

Your diplomats were able to navigate the forests of Greyharbour without too much difficulty. They were welcomed by the townsfolk, who were delighted that Stormfall had taken such an interest in their modest little town. A feast was held, and afterward, Greyharbour was more than happy to supply Stormfall with wood.
Your diplomats have returned from Greyharbour with materials, boosting Productivity.

The strange floating island you glimpse in the sky has a name. Archion, jewel of the clouds, was mounted with a unique antigravity technology. From their seat in the sky, the inhabitants have become avid slavers. Archion passes on its lowest anchorpoint over land, though one should time their trip astutely if they hope to get on for purposes of trade. The Departed, explorers from Archion, craft magnificent bows if oneâs willing to risk the journey for them. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Bows.

The caravan has returned safely from Archion. They reached the floating city just in time; in fact, it was mere hours before it was due to take flight again. They met with some of the Departedâs rangers and managed to trade for some exceptional bows.
Your diplomats have returned from Archion with Bows.

Two titanic beasts walk side by side in the Jeweled Concordat, with a bridge hanging between them and a city resting on their backs: Câtul. Its people are hunters, spiritually bound to the jungle. Strange creatures roam the woodlands. They may be a danger to those unfamiliar with Câtul. One might still want to venture there, as the city produces peerlessly sharp hunting knives and daggers meant to avoid as much suffering in their prey as possible. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Daggers.

The mission to Câtul was a success. After being welcomed aboard the hulking beasts of Câtul, your diplomats were invited on a hunt. When they returned, the hunters gave their daggers as gifts to your diplomats, the blood from their kills dried upon the blades. A reminder of the life given to strengthen the bond between Stormfall and Câtul.
Your diplomats have returned from Câtul with Daggers.

Salander is the last vestige of an underground network. It houses an academy for the purpose of Enneract study, directed by the Augur. One mustnât lose their way in the winding tunnels to Salander: the nearby ruins are cursed, and none come back from them. Still, many are tempted: various abnormalities in Salander indicate a large cache of Enneracts somewhere nearby. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Gold and Primordial Affinity (Large Quantity).

The mission to Salander was a success. Your representatives visited the Cabal of Illumination, meeting the Augur who resides over its operations. They talked at length about the Cabalâs experiments with magic, and, happy with the conduct of your representatives, the Augur gave them gold and energy crystals for the return journey.
Your diplomats have returned from Salander with Gold and Primordial Affinity.

The city of Three-Peaks lies precariously balanced on three mountaintops, holding on only by a wish and a dream. Dreams are in large supply: the slopes below grow the strongest opiates in the four realms. The waters between Stormfall and Three-Peaks are well-charted territory, but theyâre assailed by the navies of both Kuei and the Republic, with scavengers not far behind to pick up the pieces. A sample of the local narcotics may reward any pains taken. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Endgame Consumable.

Your diplomats were successful on their trip to Three-Peaks. The ascent was difficult, but at the summit, they were invited to enjoy the pleasures that the city had to offer. After indulging in the various opiates provided by the cityâs leaders, so pleased were they by the antics of your diplomats, the leaders of Three-Peaks insisted that some be taken back to Stormfallâs regent.
Your diplomats have returned from Three-Peaks with Spices.

Of all the city states in the Concordat, Gomora has the greatest reason for desiring independence from the Republic. They donât criminalize the practice of magic as others do, and an occult commerce has developed there. The journey from Stormfall to Gomora takes one across the deathly Sea of Torment. The island is lost in the middle of nowhere, almost impossible to find, but no other place practices Primordial magic so freely. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Primordial Affinity (Large Quantity).

Of all the city states in the Jeweled Concordat, Gomora has the greatest reason to protect its independence from the Republic. The city doesnât criminalize the practice of magic as others do, and an occult commerce has developed there.\n\nThe island on which Gomora rests is lost in the middle of the Canting Sea, accessible only to the most quick thinking wayfarers. But the reward that waits at shore canât be found anywhere else.
Your diplomats have returned from Gomora with Primordial Affinity.

Itâs best to ponder affairs before attempting to trade with the United Republic of Mankind. After all, the Jeweled Concordat only crystallized as an alliance when we saw the Republic invade our neighbours. Thereâs no opportunity they wonât employ to spread their ideology. Enter their territory as a magic user, and your life is forfeit. But anyone willing to submit to the regime for a trip might sell basic supplies with ease. The Republicans invest too little into agricultural infrastructure, preferring the business of war. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Gold (Medium Quantity).

Although they did not receive the warmest of welcomes, your diplomatsâ mission to the Republic was a success. The transaction was curt. They went in, said some words, traded what they had, and returned with gold on the wagons. The Republic did not seem very eager to prolong the interaction.
Your diplomats have returned from the URM with Gold.

The dense jungle of the Kuei Empire hardly seems inviting to caravans, and yet, a network of roads splits the land into manageable portions. The nation produces dye, wood, and many more materials, while still providing bread to its citizens. Itâs best to take care on the imperial highways, however. Kuei merchants warn of a bandit group known as the Jade Legion, whoâve emptied many a caravan clean of goods. Whatâs more, the Republican Liberator forces stick to the roads, knowing better than to try themselves against the jungle. Potential Outcomes:

Temporary Productivity Boost.

Your diplomats reached Kuei safe and sound, their ships managing to navigate the seas and reach Kueiâs shores. After meeting with the Empireâs dignitaries, an agreement was made and materials were exchanged for Stormfallâs gold. Kueiâs dignitaries seemed a little surprised that your diplomats had managed to reach there in one piece; the Jade Legion is an ever-looming threat, after all.
Your diplomats have returned from Kuei with materials, boosting Stormfallâs Productivity.

The tundras of Varg are being ripped at the seams by a dozen clans, like children fighting over a toy. The royal meadhallâs last attempt at unity came in the shape of a boy, unceremoniously pushed onto the throne. The clans suspect outside intervention in this succession, particularly from the Republic. Entering through battlelines with the Republican Liberators is inadvisable, though the ship ride to Vargâs coast will be long. Any expedition risks being met with hostility, but show the food in your palm and the litigants ought to heel. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Gold (Large Quantity).

The journey through Varg was tense, but in the end, your diplomats managed to make the trip a profitable one. In the ancestral homes of each clan, they were met with hostility, but after seeing the supplies that Stormfall had on offer, the Vargians could not refuse the opportunity to trade. As a result, the wagons were laden with gold upon the diplomats' return.
Your diplomats have returned from Varg with Gold.

The Brotherhood of Dawn may assemble warriors, but it also assembles the faithful. The creed of AnathÃ«a preaches an openness to newcomers, which while not evangelical, allows many to gain power from the Lady of Dawn. The Brotherhood of Dawn has had precious few allies since the United Republic of Mankind came into power. Given a show of good will, we should arrive in one piece. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Primordial Affinity.

The Brotherhood of Dawn was happy to receive your diplomats, making them feel right at home amongst the devotees of AnathÃ«a. Knowing of your abilities and the magical energy required for you to continue serving the people of Wolcen as you do, the Brotherhood provided your diplomats with numerous energy crystals to bring back to Stormfall.
Your diplomats have returned from the Brotherhood of Dawn with Primordial Affinity.

Nothing should be able to live in the Salt Deserts of MorkaÃ¯, and yet something does. Below the Tower of Salt, a circle of blind monks toils in the mines. The diamonds that they collect are the very same that fortify the Radiant Fleet. The monks warn merchant caravans from entering the caves, claiming they are home to an evil that only they are shielded from. Figures of women and men in anguish stand inside, sculpted in sand. Any enterprise taken towards the diamond mines should be carefully considered. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Gems and Sarigems.

Your diplomats were met by a group of Monks on the edge of the Salt Desert. They provided escort, using their walking sticks to check for any unusual vibrations. A number of detours had to be taken, to avoid the legendary creature worming below the surface. When questioned, they would not utter its name, for doing so is akin to summoning a demon, they said. They reached the Diamond Mines without further incident and brought back a wealth of gems.
Your diplomats returned from the Diamond Mines with Gems.

Rumour tells of an inn where strange folk go. Depending on who tells the story, youâll find it at the edge of the world, or at the corner of your street when the wind changes on a new moon. In either case, itâs no place for a mortal. The Landlady opens her door to fey types and grants them shelter around a dim candlelight. One shudders to think how theyâd react to an interruption. Those who claim to have walked by describe the rattling of the walls and howling inside the house, culminating in a moment where all sound goes mute. Potential Outcomes:

Loot received: Ethereal Reagents.

Your representatives have returned safely from their journey to the Whisperâs Rest Inn. The landlady welcomed them with open arms; she knew what they were there for. Once pleasantries were exchanged, she led them down to the cellar. She conducted some ritual, and at one point your diplomats swore they were about to be sacrificed to the monsters of the abyss. Alas, they neednât have worried. Once the ritual was complete, the lady of the Inn gave them Ethereal Reagents as an offering to the regent of Stormfall.
Your diplomats have returned from Whisperâs Rest Inn with Ethereal Reagents.

Your diplomats have returned from their mission. In the end, they were unable to make it to their destination. They did, however, come upon another wandering caravan while out on the roads, and were able to make a small trade, so the journey was not a complete waste.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

Your diplomats were unable to reach their intended destination. After torrential rainfall, the wagons drove straight into a thick mire. Despite their best efforts, the wagons had to be left behind. They managed to recover a fraction of what they had taken with them, loaded onto the horses, and were able to make some smaller trades with the villages they passed through on the way home.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

After reaching their destination and parking their wagons, the local leaders approached your diplomats, excessively apologetic. Apparently, even though they valued their ties with Stormfall dearly, they found themselves unable to give as much as they would have liked to your diplomats. Little could be done to change their minds, and so the diplomats returned, not with what they had hoped, but something to show nonetheless.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

While en route to their destination, your diplomats were chased off the beaten track by bandits. After finding a suitable spot to lay low, the Thunderblades escorting the caravan set up an ambush. They were swift and ruthless and managed to take a number of the bandits as hostages, including, they discerned, the son of a bandit chieftain. After being escorted to the bandit camp, your diplomats were able to trade the son for a hefty ransom.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

Your diplomats were buffeted off course by tempestuous winds and the wrathful waves of the open ocean. Despite their misfortune, they ran aground on an island, encountering a small commune. They were not quite used to visitors; and seeing the strange, alien objects owned by the diplomats, they were eager to trade some of their own belongings.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

Your diplomats have returned, but not from their intended destination. After sailing for a number of days, they were intercepted by a small fleet of Republic ships. Your diplomats were led to a nearby Republican outpost, where they were questioned on their cargo and their destination. After discerning the contents of the ships, the Republic demanded a trade, albeit at a reduced rate to what your diplomats were expecting.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

While out on the open seas, your diplomats came across a small merchant convoy, traveling in the same direction. After signaling, your diplomats had their ship anchored alongside the merchants, and after a short discussion, realized that they were carrying valuable cargo. They proved willing to trade it to, leaving the diplomats happy enough to return to Stormfall without reaching their intended destination.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

Part-way to their destination, a pirate ship emerged from a cove to pursue your diplomats. Desperate to escape, they had to abandon their current course and turn around for Stormfall. They were followed into a storm, and when they emerged, they noticed the pirate ship sinking. Unable to believe their luck, your diplomats turned the ship around, allowing a couple of survivors to be brought on board as captives. In exchange for their lives, the pirates led the diplomats to their buried treasure.
Your diplomats did not reach their destination, but still managed to conduct some trade.

The time has long passed for your diplomatsâ return. They should have been back in Stormfall weeks ago. With no news from them at this point in time, it is safe to assume that they are never coming back
Your diplomats did not returned from their mission.

After arriving at their destination, feet weary and dust scratching at their lungs, your diplomats entered negotiations. Unfortunately for them, negotiations were long and protracted, and no consensus could be reached with the local leaders. In the end, your diplomats were forced to return to Stormfall with nothing to show for their troubles.

Despite arriving at their destination in good time, negotiations with the local leaders did not go as well as your diplomats would have hoped. One of your diplomats, perhaps who had missed the briefing before departure, made some gesture or other that offended the sensibilities of the locals. Consequently, no trade was made, and your diplomats returned empty-handed.

After mooring their ship at their intended destination, your diplomats met with the local leaders. Talks went on for hours, beginning in the morning and stretching to the early hours of the following morning. Realizing that no consensus could be reached, your diplomats made the return journey to Stormfall, their ship lighter than they would have liked.

The sailing had been hard-going for your diplomats, meaning that they arrived at their destination much later than intended. The local leaders, offended by this tardiness, decided to not be forthcoming with the goods they could offer. Consequently, your diplomats were forced to sail home empty-handed.

Many of Stormfallâs land-based trade routes are the descendants of old dirt paths carved through the landscape. This slows down the progress of caravans looking to trade, especially during wet weather, as their wagons often get bogged down in the mud. If you were to invest in stone-cobbled roads, progress would be far easier, making trade partners more likely to invest more time and money exporting their goods to Stormfall. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.
Roadworks have been completed, making it easier and faster for caravans to reach Stormfall. This should encourage your trade partners to send caravans with increasing frequency from now on.
Roadworks have been completed, boosting Stormfallâs Productivity.

Despite being surrounded by water, Stormfall struggles to supply its citizens with a reliable supply of clean drinking water. The city has relied on a local river that runs into the sea nearby, but years of pollution from the sewers have riddled the riverâs water with diseases. The riverâs source lies quite a distance upstream, but if you were to build an aqueduct connecting its water to Stormfall, the risk of disease would be reduced tremendously. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Construction work on the new Aqueduct has been completed, giving Stormfall access to a new, clean water source. With clean water flowing through your citizens, they are now less likely to contract water-borne diseases.
The Aqueduct has been completed, boosting Stormfallâs Productivity.

Sanitation in Stormfall has always been an issue that has plagued its citizens. The sewer system is a relic of another era, barely able to cope with the population within Stormfallâs walls, even despite the recent deaths incurred on its people. Sewage flows downward, making the spread of disease worse in the lower ring. If the sewers were expanded and made to direct the sewage off the streets, the risk of disease should fall and thus strengthen the cityâs work-force. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Renovation work on the sewers has finished. The flow of the cityâs waste no longer goes through the cityâs streets, where it is most likely to fester and spread disease among your citizens. With the streets cleaned up, your citizens are less likely to contract diseases.
Sewer Renovations have been completed, boosting Stormfallâs Productivity.

A recent innovation in agricultural practice has been brought to your attention. Currently, your farmers grow the same crop in the same field every year. In the Republic, however, they rotate which crops are grown on a field in any given year. Apparently, this means that different nutrients from the soil are used during each rotation, meaning that yield is less likely to suffer. If your farmers were to adopt this practice, yields were more consistent, providing a greater food supply to the city. Outcomes:

Productivity will be permanently increased.

Your farmers have been trained in the agricultural practice of crop rotation. With different crops being grown in the same field every year, the nutrients required for each crop are able to replenish themselves in the soil when they are not being absorbed. This makes yields more reliable and the citizens feel more secure knowing they will be well fed.
